description: Draft 7-step decision tree mapping project descriptions to SF building permit requirements. Synthesized from G-20 routing matrix, permit forms taxonomy, in-house review process, and supplementary info sheets.
known_gaps: GAP-1: OTC vs In-House criteria (needs AB-093)
GAP-2: Fee calculation formulas (G-13 scanned, needs OCR)
GAP-3: Timeline estimates (sparse data, needs Amy input)
GAP-4: Planning pre-approval rules (needs Planning Code cross-reference)

step_1_need_permit.question: Does this project need a building permit?
step_1_need_permit.description: Determine if the proposed work requires a DBI building permit

permit_required.description: Most construction work in SF requires a building permit

permit_may_not_be_required.description: Very minor work may be exempt, but confirm with DBI
examples: Minor repairs (less than $500 value, same material)
permit_may_not_be_required.warning: Even seemingly minor work may require a permit in SF. When in doubt, call DBI at (415) 558-6088.

separate_processes.description: Some project types have their own permit processes outside standard DBI review

types.process: Separate ADU permit process with pre-approval application
types.reference: Detached ADU Pre-Approval Application, Info Sheet G-23

types.process: Projects under Development Agreements follow negotiated timelines
May qualify for priority processing per AB-004
Separate fire permit, not standard building permit

step_2_which_form.question: Which permit application form is needed?
step_2_which_form.description: Select the correct DBI application form based on project type

decision_logic.condition: New construction (Type I, II, III, IV - non-wood)
decision_logic.notes: Mark Form 1 checkbox on Form 1/2. Construction types: Fire-Resistive, Non-Combustible, Ordinary, Heavy Timber.

decision_logic.condition: Additions, alterations, or repairs to existing buildings (large scope)
decision_logic.notes: Mark Form 3 checkbox. This is the 'pink form' — most building applications use this. Triggers In-House Review.

decision_logic.condition: Small projects eligible for over-the-counter review
decision_logic.notes: Mark Form 8 checkbox. For projects that can be reviewed over the counter or do not require plans.
decision_logic.gap: GAP-1: Exact OTC eligibility criteria need AB-093

decision_logic.notes: For all signs including attached, monument, and post-mounted signs. Per Info Sheet G-04.

decision_logic.condition: Demolition of existing building or structure
decision_logic.notes: Often paired with Form 1/2 for new construction. Requires asbestos report per DBI rules. Requires BAAQMD Job Number for issuance per S-04.
Separate application form for pre-approval of detached Accessory Dwelling Units.

additional_forms_that_may_be_required: Permit Applicant Disclosure and Certification form
Demolition Affidavit Form (for demolitions — declares mortgage/deed holders notified)
Disabled Access Upgrade Compliance Checklist (all commercial TI projects)
San Francisco Green Building Form (GS1-GS6 depending on project type)
SFPUC fixture count form (if adding plumbing fixtures or new water service)

step_3_otc_or_inhouse.question: Is this project eligible for OTC (over-the-counter) review, or does it require In-House Review?
step_3_otc_or_inhouse.description: Determines whether project can be reviewed at DBI counter (fast) or requires multi-agency in-house review (weeks-months)

otc_eligible.description: Projects that MAY qualify for OTC review based on G-20 'Work with No Plans' category and general DBI guidance

known_otc_categories_from_g20.scope: Remodel of existing kitchen and/or existing bathroom
known_otc_categories_from_g20.conditions: No structural work or wall removal, no new plumbing fixtures

known_otc_categories_from_g20.scope: Furnace replacement in-kind with duct work

known_otc_categories_from_g20.conditions: Planning review conditional on ground/street level
No removal of wood shingle, no re-sheathing, no plywood replacement

known_otc_categories_from_g20.scope: Repair in-kind of less than 50% of existing deck
Repair in-kind of less than 50% of existing stairs
Replacement in-kind or repair of existing siding
Replacement of existing siding to new siding
known_otc_categories_from_g20.conditions: Planning conditional on visibility from street

known_otc_categories_from_g20.scope: Voluntary installation of anchor bolts and plywood sheathing at first story of residential wood-frame buildings

otc_eligible.gap_note: GAP-1: Full OTC eligibility criteria require AB-093. The above are only the G-20 'Work with No Plans' entries which are a subset of OTC-eligible work.

inhouse_required.description: Projects requiring multi-agency review through DBI's In-House Review process
triggers: Structural work (wall removal, new openings, foundations)
Any work requiring multiple agency review per G-20 matrix
inhouse_required.timeline: 4+ weeks for DBI review after Planning approval. Larger scopes take longer.

full_vs_site_permit.description: For In-House Review, choose between Full Permit or Site Permit process

full_permit.description: Condensed process, preferred by most customers
full_permit.payments: Two: initial filing fee + issuance fee

site_permit.payments: Minimum four: filing fee, issuance fee, addendum submittal fee, addendum issuance fee
site_permit.process: Addenda submitted after site permit issuance per approved schedule

full_vs_site_permit.key_rule: Cannot switch between Full and Site Permit without resubmitting application

step_4_agency_routing.question: Which City agencies must review this permit application?
step_4_agency_routing.description: Based on the G-20 routing matrix (154 scope-of-work entries), determines which agencies review the permit. Routing varies by project scope, location, and building characteristics.

common_triggers: Exterior changes visible from public way
Ground floor or street-level commercial work
conditional_triggers: Interior tenant improvement at ground/street or second floor (#)
PLANNING.pre_approval: Many projects require Planning zoning approval BEFORE building permit submission. In OCII areas, route to OCII instead.

BLDG.full_name: DBI Architectural and Structural Plan Review
BLDG.common_triggers: Almost all permitted work requires BLDG review
conditional_triggers: HVAC work over 400 lbs per unit (^)

MECH_MECH_E.full_name: DBI Mechanical Plan Review / Electrical Plan Review
conditional_triggers: MECH only for certain work types (#)
Any SFFD-regulated occupancy: High-rise, A, E, H, I, L, or R except R-3 (*)
R2 occupancy with construction cost $99K+ (per G20-M)
exceptions: Kitchen/bath no-plan permit: skip SFFD unless cost >$99K in R2 (per G20-J)

BSM.full_name: DPW Bureau of Street-Use and Mapping
common_triggers: New openings for food service (pass-thru windows)
conditional_triggers: Improvements at building entry/exit points adjacent to public right-of-way (^)
exemptions_per_g20: Element affixed to building ≤4 inches into Public Way
Minor utility fixtures authorized by previous permit

common_triggers: Stormwater management (5,000+ sq ft impervious surfaces)
Water reuse systems (40,000+ sq ft projects)

triggers_per_g20_rule_c: New construction/remodel of buildings under DPH programs
Medical Cannabis Dispensing facilities (DPH first, then Planning)
Soil disturbance of 50+ cubic yards in Maher Area
Soil disturbance of any volume in Health Code Article 31 Area
DPH.exception: Do NOT route Article 38 (enhanced ventilation) construction plans to DPH

OCII.full_name: Office of Community Investment and Infrastructure
OCII.trigger: Projects in OCII areas route to OCII INSTEAD of Planning (per G20-E)
OCII.note: OCII is last station to review. Reviews all permit addenda.

PW_DAC.full_name: DPW Office of Disability Access Coordinator
triggers: Site permit and architectural addendum for new construction, alteration, addition, or change in occupancy/use
Any City project or project receiving public funds

CON_BOND.trigger: Multi-residential building increasing unit count by 10+ (per G20-N)

exterior_work.description: Work affecting building exterior or visible from outside

work_with_no_plans.description: Smaller projects that may not require full plan sets — potential OTC candidates
example_scopes: Kitchen/bath remodel (no structural, no new fixtures)

others.description: Special categories including health/environmental triggers, city property, and compliance items

step_5_required_docs.question: What documents and plans are required for submission?
step_5_required_docs.description: Documents required vary by form type and project scope

universal_requirements.document: Completed permit application form (appropriate Form 1/2, 3/8, 4/7, 5, or 6)
universal_requirements.details: Must be filled out completely with accurate project description

universal_requirements.document: Construction plans (PDF for electronic plan review)
universal_requirements.details: Prepared by licensed architect or engineer. All plan sets must include a Back Check page.
universal_requirements.exceptions: Some 'Work with No Plans' categories per G-20 may not require plans

universal_requirements.document: Permit Applicant and Authorized Agent form
universal_requirements.details: Must be signed by property owner
Per info sheets M-03, M-04, M-08. Exceptions per M-06.

conditional_requirements.trigger: Projects requiring Planning review (most exterior work, change of use)
conditional_requirements.notes: Must be obtained BEFORE building permit submission

conditional_requirements.trigger: Projects in OCII areas (instead of Planning)
All commercial tenant improvement projects, projects in existing commercial buildings
New construction or projects adding new floor area
Creating/replacing 5,000+ sq ft impervious surfaces (combined sewer) or 2,500+ (separate sewer)
Adding faucets, toilets, plumbing fixtures, or new water service
New construction, commercial additions 1,000+ sq ft, commercial remodels $200K+, full demolitions
50+ cubic yards soil disturbance in Maher area or any soil in Article 31 area
Demolition permits — declares mortgage/deed holders notified
Signs on new buildings (2 copies with Form 3/8)

plan_format.submission: Electronic PDF via building permit application portal
plan_format.prepared_by: Licensed architect or engineer (required for all permit plans)
plan_format.include: Back Check page in all plan sets

step_6_timeline.question: How long will the permit process take?
step_6_timeline.description: Timeline estimates based on available data. SIGNIFICANT GAP — most timelines are not published by DBI.
step_6_timeline.gap_warning: GAP-3: DBI does not publish standard processing timelines. These estimates are derived from scattered references in info sheets and should be verified with Amy.

otc_review.notes: Simple projects may be approved while you wait. Some OTC projects may take additional review time.

inhouse_review_small.description: In-house review for smaller scope of work
inhouse_review_small.notes: Per G-25 Restaurant FAQ: 'smaller scopes of work may qualify to be reviewed and potentially approved over-the-counter while you wait'

inhouse_review_standard.notes: Includes multiple agency reviews. May be longer if comments require multiple revision rounds.

conditional_use_permit.description: Projects requiring Conditional Use permit from Planning
conditional_use_permit.estimate: 3+ months for Planning review alone (per G-25 Restaurant FAQ)
conditional_use_permit.notes: Requires public hearing. Neighborhood notification may also be required.

site_permit.estimate: Months to years depending on project complexity
site_permit.notes: Iterative process with multiple addenda. Per AB-032.

categories: Clean energy systems only (solar, ESS, EV charging, wind)
priority_processing.notes: Priority applications may be given priority assignment for plan review and issuance per AB-004.

process_notes.completeness_review: 3 rounds of incomplete evaluations → escalated to DBI supervisor
process_notes.comment_rounds: 3 rounds of comments/revisions → escalated to DBI supervisor
process_notes.cal_osha: Cal OSHA Industrial Safety Permit may be required for buildings >36ft/3 stories or trenches/excavations 5+ ft deep

step_7_fees.question: What fees will be required?
step_7_fees.description: Fee information based on available data. SIGNIFICANT GAP — detailed fee schedules are in G-13 (scanned, needs OCR).
step_7_fees.gap_warning: GAP-2: Complete fee calculation requires Info Sheet G-13 which is a scanned PDF (0 chars extracted). Fees are percentage-based on construction cost per SFBC Section 110A.

filing_fee.description: Initial filing fee paid when submitting application
filing_fee.calculation: Based on estimated construction cost per DBI fee schedule
filing_fee.reference: www.sfdbi.org/fees → 'Alteration Building Permit' under 'Permit Fee Tables'

issuance_fee.description: Paid when permit is approved and ready for issuance
issuance_fee.calculation: Based on construction cost, adjusted per DBI Cost Schedule

site_permit_fees.description: Site Permit process has minimum 4 payment stages

school_impact_fee.description: SFUSD-levied fee for projects increasing commercial floor area
school_impact_fee.trigger: Any project that increases floor area for commercial occupancies
school_impact_fee.timing: Must be paid PRIOR to permit issuance

step_7_fees.cost_note: DBI may adjust proposed construction cost according to latest edition of DBI Cost Schedule. Consult licensed professional for accurate estimates.

restaurant_change_of_use.description: Opening a new restaurant (change of use to restaurant)
process: Step 1: Visit Planning Department first to confirm zoning allows restaurants at site
Step 2: Some neighborhoods prohibit additional sit-down restaurants but may allow counter-service
Step 3: If Conditional Use required: 3+ months, public hearing, neighborhood notification
Step 4: After Planning approval, apply for building permit
Step 5: Plans required — prepared by licensed architect/engineer, 2 sets minimum
Step 6: SFFD review triggered if Group A-2 occupancy (>49 occupants) or building >75ft
Step 7: Accessibility (Chapter 11B) requirements triggered for alteration/structural repair
Step 8: Seismic retrofit triggered if >10% increase in building occupant load AND >100 person increase
Step 9: Separate sign permit (Form 4/7) after building permit issued
Step 10: Separate electrical and plumbing permits (building permit Form 3/8 should indicate both needed)
restaurant_change_of_use.costs: Permit fee is percentage of construction cost per SFBC Section 110A. School Impact Fee may apply per G-11.

adu_construction.description: Accessory Dwelling Unit construction or legalization
adu_construction.source: Info Sheet G-23 (referenced, partially in tier2)
key_rules: Separate ADU permit process with pre-approval application for detached ADUs
May qualify for priority processing per AB-004 (creating new dwelling units)

seismic_retrofit.routing: Routes to PLANNING, BLDG, and conditionally SFFD
seismic_retrofit.priority: Qualifies for priority processing per AB-004
seismic_retrofit.notes: Voluntary anchor bolt installation at first story of wood-frame may be OTC (no plans)

commercial_tenant_improvement.description: Interior tenant improvement for commercial space

routing.PLANNING: Required on ground/street level or second floor (#)
routing.BSM: Conditional — entry/exit improvements adjacent to right-of-way (^)
routing.PUC: Conditional — adding plumbing fixtures (Ø), OCII areas only (//)

commercial_tenant_improvement.disabled_access: Disabled Access Compliance Checklist required for all commercial TI projects

adaptive_reuse.notes: Detailed guidelines for converting commercial buildings to residential use. Full content available in knowledge base.

solar_clean_energy.description: Solar PV, Energy Storage Systems, EV Charging
solar_clean_energy.routing: Varies by system type — rooftop solar typically routes to BLDG and potentially PLANNING
solar_clean_energy.priority: Qualifies for priority processing per AB-004 (clean energy supply systems)

pre_application_checklist.description: Pre-application requirements that must be completed BEFORE submitting building permit

items.action: Visit Planning at 1660 Mission St, 1st Floor, or call (415) 558-6377
Receive letter from OCII instead of Planning

items.trigger: Projects creating 40,000+ sq ft of space (100,000+ sq ft requires onsite reuse)
Creating/replacing 5,000+ sq ft impervious surfaces (combined sewer) or 2,500+ (separate)
New construction or adding new floor area
New construction, commercial additions 1,000+ sq ft, commercial remodels $200K+, full demolitions
50+ cubic yards soil disturbance in Maher area or any volume in Article 31 area

items.action: Confirm property has valid address via SF Property Information Map
